attributes.action: Cancel A Level exams instead of delaying them.
attributes.additional_details: Delaying A Levels to the summer holidays will make the university enrolment process shorter and harder as well as rushing examiners to mark with less time. People may also have already booked holidays. A better alternative is to cancel A levels overall and award students their predicted grades.
attributes.background: Cancel the A Level exams in May and June instead of delaying them to the summer holidays in order to ease pressure on students, examiners and universities during the spread of the COVID-19.

rejection.details:
Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards and individual schools, and are not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public
